channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Potholes, 20th September
item.description:
Numerous shallow, but growing, potholes between lanes 1 and 2. Present for months. Impossible to avoid if travelling from Cheltenham Road, and staying in the lane to exit towards Churchdown on the Elmbridge Court Roundabout
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmbridge Court Roundabout, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Vegetation problem, 20th September
item.description:
PLEASE CUT BACK HEDGE 1 M BACK FROM 12M 3 WAY STOP AND GO NOT MARKED (Overgrown Hedge)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects -CW6 Potholes problem, 20th September
item.description:
15DB CWPH 500 X 300 X 43mm MARKED AS NUMBER (CW6 Pothole)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light out on the corner by the railway bridge, 20th September
item.description:
Street light not working on the corner of Church Road. Not sure if this contributed to/or as a result of an accident that happened 20/09. Police attended. 02.45.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hyde Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Caravan left unattended, 19th September
item.description:
Gl33ln outside cherry gardens. Caravan has been there for three months now and nobody is attending to it. It's a total eyesore for the area. Possible safety issues due to gas bottles etc...

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wilkes Avenue, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Flytipping (not witnessed and no evidence likely)

10

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Churchdown, Tewkesbury

item.title: Dangerous paving., 19th September
item.description:
You cannot miss the problem. Walk down from Cowper and you will find dangerously tilted pavement slabs. Next to the cycle path which I understand is the cause of the problem. Why has this been left in such a dangerous situation. Have to walk due to lack of bus service. Please repair.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Cowper Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light not working, 19th September
item.description:
Corner of Priory Lane/Station Road Light still not working despite recent work carried out.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Priory Lane, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A long thin 2 foot gorge shaped pothole on the nearside going north., 19th September
item.description:
This pothole is 2ft long and about 4 inches wide and extremely dangerous for motorbikes and cyclists as the wheels will get stuck in it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Three pothole cluster on New Road north bound, 19th September
item.description:
These cluster of 3 potholes are going north on the nearside and are getting bigger everyday. They are very dangerous to cyclists and vehicles swerving to avoid them.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown bush across path, 19th September
item.description:
There is a bush quite severely overhanging the path that runs down the side of 2 Drake Close. I believe the bush belongs to the above house, but means that pedestrians - especially cyclists, buggies and wheelchair users can’t get past.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Drake Close, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees leaning precariously top section Stockwell Lane and the B4632, 19th September
item.description:
Please can GCC we cut back the hedges to provide visibility for cars descending the hill. At present cars have to cross to the other side of the lane on the descent. This is an accident waiting to happen.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stockwell Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Junction of Stockwell Lane and the B4632, 19th September
item.description:
As part of Gloucestershire County Council‘s clean sweep, please can we remove the following without further delay: Road closure sign lying face down on the grass verge with two cones.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4632, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
